| Default  | 0     | Enables the Stealth workgroup COI to both initiate outbound tunnels and accept inbound tunnels.                                                            |
| Initiate | 16201 | Restricts the Stealth workgroup COI to initiate outbound Stealth tunnels. Once a tunnel is established, communication can flow in either direction.      |
| Accept   | 16202 | Restricts the Stealth workgroup COI to accept inbound Stealth tunnel requests. Once a tunnel is established, communication can flow in either direction. |
direction.x-desc:
Directional [COIs](#tag/COI) are used to manage inbound and outbound Stealth tunnel establishment.

This value is present only when querying a [role](#tag/Role) or [configuration](#tag/Configuration). In the former case, the **recursive** option can be set to either true or false. In the latter case, it must be set to true.

When creating a COI within a role, this field is ignored for a service COI (and the value **Default** is used). Also, the value **Default** is used if no value is specified for a workgroup COI.

When updating a COI within a role, this field cannot be changed for service COIs, and it is ignored.

When updating a COI that does not belong to a role, this field is ignored.

id.description:
The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to the COI by Enterprise Manager.

The unique identifier is ignored for the create request. If the COI is associated with a role, refer to the [Create Role](#operation/createRole) request for a description of how the unique identifier is used.

isService.description: An indicator of whether the COI is a service COI or a workgroup COI. This field can only be updated if the COI is not in use.

name.description: The [name](#section/Validation/Names) of the COI.

Coi.description: A COI represents the group of Stealth endpoints that can communicate securely. A COI can be added in conjunction with other COIs for a given role.

communicationStatus.description:
The availability of the system through the network.

| Mnemonic          | Value | Description                                                                                            |
|-------------------|-------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| unknown           | 0     | The system's network connection status is unknown.                                                     |
| notAvailable      | 1     | The system is unable to report the state of its connection to the network.                             |
| ok                | 2     | Network communication is reported as satisfactory.                                                     |
| lostCommunication | 3     | The system has lost the network connection. This could be a hardware problem or a configuration issue. |
| noContact         | 4     | The system is connected to the network but is not able to contact other computers.                     |
communicationStatus.x-desc: The availability of the system through the network.

description.description: A [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the system as provided by the user.

healthState.description:
An indicator of the health of the system in regards to Stealth. It incorporates both the hardware and software components required to support the Stealth software.

| Mnemonic            | Value | Description                                                                                                      |
|---------------------|-------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| unknown             | 0     | The health state is not defined.                                                                                 |
| ok                  | 1     | The health state is ok.                                                                                          |
| degradedWarning     | 2     | The system functionality is degraded. This typically indicates that one or more Stealth services are not running.|
| minorFailure        | 3     | The system has experienced a minor failure.                                                                      |
| majorFailure        | 4     | The system has experienced a major failure.                                                                      |
| criticalFailure     | 5     | The system has experienced a critical failure.                                                                   |
| nonRecoverableError | 6     | The system has experienced a non-recoverable error.                                                              |
healthState.x-desc: An indicator of the health of the system in regards to Stealth. It incorporates both the hardware and software components required to support the Stealth software.

id.description: The unique identifier assigned to the system. The value is either the [host name](#section/Validation/Domain-Names) or [IP address](#section/Validation/IP-Address) of the system.

installedDate.description: The [time](#section/Validation/Date-and-Time) at which the system was added to the Enterprise Manager database.

name.description: An alternate, more descriptive [name](#section/Validation/Names) for the system that was provided when the system was added to the Enterprise Manager database. The default is the same value as **id**.

operationalStatus.description: A collection of operation statuses of the system. Each instance holds the operational status and its corresponding description.

otherIdentifyingInfo.description: A collection of additional information regarding the system. Possible values are the MAC address (using the format "MAC:{address}") or a unique identifier (using the format "GUID:{uuid}").

items.description: A collection of additional information regarding the system. Possible values are the MAC address (using the format "MAC:{address}") or a unique identifier (using the format "GUID:{uuid}").

primaryStatus.description:
The highest level view of the state of the system in regards to Stealth, including both hardware and software elements.

| Mnemonic | Value | Description                                                                                 |
|----------|-------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| unknown  | 0     | The state of the system cannot be determined.                                               |
| ok       | 1     | The computer is working as expected to support Stealth.                                     |
| degraded | 2     | The system has lost capability and might not support Stealth.                               |
| error    | 3     | The system is reporting an error. Check the **operationalStatus** for additional information. |
primaryStatus.x-desc: The highest level view of the state of the system in regards to Stealth, including both hardware and software elements.

role.description:
A collection of roles for installed services on the system.

| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|---------------|-----------------|------------ |
| appliance | Appliance | Has the Stealth 2.8 Appliance role. |
| authorization | Authorization | The system is running the Authorization Service. This includes Management Servers and standalone Authorization Servers. |
| license | License | Has the License Host role and is providing licenses to other systems. |
| management | Management | Has the Management Server role. |
| marketplace | AWS Marketplace | Has the AWS Marketplace role. |
| sra | SRA | Has the Secure Remote Access (SRA) Gateway role. |
| vpn | VPN | Has the Secure Virtual Gateway role. |

items.description:
| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|---------------|-----------------|------------ |
| appliance | Appliance | Has the Stealth 2.8 Appliance role. |
| authorization | Authorization | The system is running the Authorization Service. This includes Management Servers and standalone Authorization Servers. |
| license | License | Has the License Host role and is providing licenses to other systems. |
| management | Management | Has the Management Server role. |
| marketplace | AWS Marketplace | Has the AWS Marketplace role. |
| sra | SRA | Has the Secure Remote Access (SRA) Gateway role. |
| vpn | VPN | Has the Secure Virtual Gateway role. |
items.x-desc: A collection of roles for installed services on the system.

role.x-desc: A collection of roles for installed services on the system.

service.description: A collection of services on the system.

systemNumber.description: A value associated with the system, typically containing the same MAC address found in **otherIdentifyingInfo**.

timeOfLastStateChange.description: The [date and time](#section/Validation/Date-and-Time) of the most recent change in the state of the system.

url.description:
The IP address and port number used by the Stealth Monitor Service running on the system.

During a create request, the field value should be a valid URL containing the IP address and port number of a system that has the Stealth Monitor Service installed. If a port number is not specified, the default port number 443 is used.

authorizationService.description:
A list of all Authorization Services in the configuration.

This list is ignored for a global configuration.

For create and update requests, only the unique identifier (the **id** field of the **service**) is used; all other fields are ignored.

This list is maintained in the order in which it is entered.

description.description: A [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the configuration and its purpose.

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to the configuration by Enterprise Manager.

licenseService.description:
A list of all License Admin Services in the configuration.

This list is ignored for a global configuration.

For create and update requests, only the unique identifier (the **id** field of the **service**) is used; all other fields are ignored.

This list is maintained in the order in which it is entered.

name.description: A descriptive [name](#section/Validation/Names) for the configuration.

role.description:
A list of Stealth roles in the configuration.

This field is ignored when updating a configuration. See the [Role](#tag/Role) resource for information on creating, deleting, or updating roles.

type.description:
Identifies how the configuration is used. If not entered during a create request, the default value **Standard** is used. For a create request, only **Standard** or **Global** are allowed; all other values are read-only. This field is ignored during an update request; you cannot change the configuration type once created. | Mnemonic | Value | Description | |-----------|-----------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------| | BOOTSTRAP | Bootstrap | Identifies a configuration corresponding to the Profile that identifies an endpoint used by a Stealth administrator to access the Stealth Management Server.
This value is not valid when creating a configuration. | | EM | EM | Identifies a configuration corresponding to the Profile that identifies the Enterprise Server.
This value is not valid when creating a configuration. | | GLOBAL | Global | Identifies a global configuration used to isolate endpoints and users. There can be at most one global configuration in a Stealth environment. | | SAAS | SAAS | Identifies a configuration corresponding to the Profile that identifies a standalone Authorization Server.
This value is not valid when creating a configuration. | | STANDARD | Standard | Identifies a standard Stealth configuration. | | USER | User | Identifies a configuration corresponding to a Profile in a user Solution.
This value is not valid when creating a configuration. |
type.x-desc:
Identifies how the configuration is used.

If not entered during a create request, the default value **Standard** is used. For a create request, only **Standard** or **Global** are allowed; all other values are read-only. This field is ignored during an update request; you cannot change the configuration type once created.

Configuration.description: A configuration is defined by a group of roles, users, and groups as well as associated COIs and filters for a particular set of Stealth communications. A configuration is deployed by the Management Server or standalone Authorization Server for use by the endpoints using the configuration. Your environment can include one or more configurations.

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) of this newly created resource.

oldId.description: For some update requests, for some child resources (such as a Filter), the child cannot be directly updated and is instead recreated. This field contains the [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) of the child before it was updated, and the **id** field contains the new unique identifier for the child.

uri.description: The full URI that can be used to get this newly created resource. The URI can be empty if the newly created resource cannot be accessed directly.

CreatedResource.description:
If the request was to create a resource, then this is a list of information about the created resources. This field is used during create requests and in some update requests that require new resources to be created. This field is unused for all other requests.

Information about one of the created resources. The first entry in the list usually pertains to the primary resource. However, if a resource is created during an update, that resource might not be the primary resource.

description.description: An optional [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the endpoint.

displayName.description: A user friendly name for this endpoint. Defaults to **name**.

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to this endpoint by Enterprise Manager.

name.description:
The fully qualified [domain name](#section/Validation/Domain-Names) of the endpoint. This value should be the same as what is reported in the **endPointId** field for the [Session](#tag/Session) for that endpoint.

This field is ignored when updating the endpoint.

Endpoint.description:
A collection of isolated endpoints. This information is available only for a global isolation role.

To isolate endpoints (and add them to a global isolation role), use the [Isolate Users or Endpoints](#operation/isolateRole) request. To remove endpoints from isolation, use the [Unisolate Users or Endpoints](#operation/unisolateRole) request.

An endpoint that has been isolated in this global isolation role. There can be any number of endpoints in a global isolation role (including zero).

changeTime.description: The [date and time](#section/Validation/Date-and-Time) at which the individual endpoint configuration report was generated. The value reflects the system time on the endpoint, converted to UTC.

checksum.description: An SHA256 checksum of the configuration data in the **xml**  field.

lastTime.description: The most recent [date and time](#section/Validation/Date-and-Time) at which the endpoint reported this configuration. (Endpoints report their configuration every 24 hours.) The value reflects the system time on the endpoint, converted to UTC.

name.description: The fully qualified [host name](#section/Validation/Domain-Names) of the endpoint.

sequence.description:
A sequence number assigned to this entry by the endpoint.

See _Configuration Audit Report Overview_ in the _Unisys Stealth Information Center_ for more information about sequence numbers.

xml.description:
The endpoint report XML.

The Configuration Audit Report XML documents are defined by a schema, which is included in the AuditSchema folder in the Unisys Stealth Solution ISO file. The schema is named Audit.xsd, and it includes a file named StealthCommon.xsd. These two files can be used to understand the structure and contents of the XML documents generated by Stealth-enabled endpoints.

EndpointConfiguration.description: A collection of containers for individual configuration audit reports. There can be up to 100 reports.

audit.description: Indicates if configuration audit reports are enabled for the endpoint package (and will be sent by the endpoint). This value is true if enabled, false if disabled (default), and null if unknown.

basePackageType.description:
The base package operating system type.

When creating an endpoint package, this value cannot be set to **unknown**; it must match the operating system of the endpoint on which you want to install the endpoint package.

| Mnemonic | Value | Description                                   |
|----------|-------|-----------------------------------------------|
| unknown  | 0     | The operating system type is not defined.     |
| Win64    | 1     | A Windows 64-bit operating system is defined. |
| Win32    | 2     | A Windows 32-bit operating system is defined. |
| Linux    | 3     | A Linux operating system is defined.          |
basePackageType.x-desc:
The base package operating system type.

When creating an endpoint package, this value cannot be set to **unknown**; it must match the operating system of the endpoint on which you want to install the endpoint package.

certName.description:
The certificate name, if certificate-based authorization is used. (This can be null, if the endpoint uses LDAP or Integrated Windows Authentication instead.) This can be either a common name or an [Object Identifier](#section/Validation/Object-Identifier).

The following are the Unisys default values:

* Common Name (User Name Authorization) - StealthAuthentication
* Enhanced Key Usage (Computer Name Authorization) - 1.3.6.1.4.1.223.52.1.1
* Enhanced Key Usage (User Name Authorization) - 1.3.6.1.4.1.223.52.1.2

certType.description:
The type of certificate, if certificate-based authorization is used. If no value for this field is provided, a default value of **none** will be used instead.

| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|---------------|-----------------|------------ |
| unknown | 0 | The certificate lookup mechanism has not been specified. |
| none | 1 | There is no certificate. |
| commonName | 2 | Use the common name specified in the certificate name field to find the CBA certificate (Common Name (User Name Authorization)). |
| ekuComputer | 3 | Use the Enhanced Key Usage (EKU) value specified in the certificate name field to find the CBA certificate among the certificates registered for the computer (Enhanced Key Usage (Computer Name Authorization)). |
| ekuUser | 4 | Use the Enhanced Key Usage (EKU) value specified in the certificate name field to find the CBA certificate among the certificates registered for the user (Enhanced Key Usage (User Name Authorization)). |
certType.x-desc: The type of certificate, if certificate-based authorization is used. If no value for this field is provided, a default value of **none** will be used instead.

configurationId.description:
A list of configuration unique identifiers. Enterprise Manager allows you to add multiple configurations to an endpoint package.

You cannot specify the global isolation configuration.

items.description:
A list of configuration unique identifiers. Enterprise Manager allows you to add multiple configurations to an endpoint package.

You cannot specify the global isolation configuration.

creationDate.description: The [date](#section/Validation/Date-and-Time) when the endpoint package was created.

description.description: The [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the endpoint package provided by the user.

endpointMode.description:
The endpoint mode that determines the endpoint behavior.

| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|---------------|-----------------|------------ |
| CAO      | ClientAlwaysOn | This is a client endpoint, and Stealth is always enabled.                                      |
| COD      | ClientOnDemand | This is a client endpoint, and Stealth can be enabled or disabled by the logged in user.       |
| SAO      | ServerAlwaysOn | This is a server endpoint, and Stealth is always enabled.                                      |
| SOD      | ServerOnDemand | This is a server endpoint, and Stealth can be enabled or disabled by the server administrator. |
endpointMode.x-desc: The endpoint mode that determines the endpoint behavior.

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to the endpoint package by Enterprise Manager.

name.description:
The [name](#section/Validation/Names) of the endpoint package.

When creating an endpoint package, this field should be a simple file name, not a full file path. If this field is set to a full file path, the simple file name will be extracted and used instead.

When reading an endpoint package, this field is set to the full file path.

profileName.description:
The [name](#section/Validation/Names) of the settings profile, which is used to correlate the original endpoint package and any revisions.

This field is ignored during an update.

revision.description: The revision number is incremented if the endpoint package is updated with either new settings or new base software. In either case, a new endpoint package file is created. Starts at 1.

softwareLevel.description: The version string of the Enterprise Manager software.

useStealthTunnelingPriority.description: Indicates processing priority for the endpoint; that is, whether it should prioritize Stealth traffic over clear text traffic after a Stealth tunnel is created. Set the value to false if you want to prioritize clear text traffic (the default) or to true if you want to prioritize Stealth traffic. Null will default to clear text priority.

auditReporting.description: Indicates whether Configuration Audit Reports (CAR) should be sent by the endpoints.

authorization.description:
A list of Authorization Sets for the Endpoint Property Set.

For a load request, only the **id** field is examined and must reference an existing Authorization Set.

This list is maintained in the order in which it is entered.

certName.description:
The [certificate name](#section/Validation/Certificate-Names) used for certificate authentication.

The certificate name is required if **certType** is set to **commonName**, **ekuComputer**, or **ekuUser**.

certType.description:
The type of certificate used for certificate authentication.

Note that the value **0** or **unknown**, while a valid certificate type, is not used for Endpoint Property Sets and automatically converts to the value **none**.

| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|---------------|-----------------|------------ |
| none | 1 | There is no certificate. |
| commonName | 2 | Use the common name specified in the certificate name field to find the CBA certificate (Common Name (User Name Authorization)). |
| ekuComputer | 3 | Use the Enhanced Key Usage (EKU) value specified in the certificate name field to find the CBA certificate among the certificates registered for the computer (Enhanced Key Usage (Computer Name Authorization)). |
| ekuUser | 4 | Use the Enhanced Key Usage (EKU) value specified in the certificate name field to find the CBA certificate among the certificates registered for the user (Enhanced Key Usage (User Name Authorization)). |

deploymentId.description: An [identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) used to relate the request with all Stealth(aware) objects affected by the request.

description.description: The [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the Endpoint Property Set.

endpointMode.description:
The Stealth mode defined for the endpoints in the Endpoint Property Set.

| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|---------------|-----------------|------------ |
| CAO      | ClientAlwaysOn | This is a client endpoint, and Stealth is always enabled.                                      |
| COD      | ClientOnDemand | This is a client endpoint, and Stealth can be enabled or disabled by the logged in user.       |
| SAO      | ServerAlwaysOn | This is a server endpoint, and Stealth is always enabled.                                      |
| SOD      | ServerOnDemand | This is a server endpoint, and Stealth can be enabled or disabled by the server administrator. |
endpointMode.x-desc: The Stealth mode defined for the endpoints in the Endpoint Property Set.

id.description:
The Endpoint Property Set identifier.

The value can contain letters and numbers and is case-insensitive. For example, "aaa" and "Aaa" are the same identifiers. The identifier is always stored in all uppercase, as in the example identifier "AAA".

The value "0" is reserved for system use.

Use a value of "DEFC" to define an Endpoint Property Set for client nodes that are not defined as a [Node Map](#tag/Node-Map). Use a value of "DEFS" to define an Endpoint Property Set for server nodes that are not defined as a Node Map.

name.description: The [name](#section/Validation/Names) of the Endpoint Property Set.

useStealthTunnelingPriority.description: The processing priority for the endpoint, which determines whether it should prioritize Stealth traffic over clear text traffic after a Stealth tunnel is created. Set the value to false if you want to prioritize clear text traffic or to true if you want to prioritize Stealth traffic. If not specified, clear text priority is assumed.

EndpointPropertySet.description: An Endpoint Property Set is a group of attributes used to build the Authorization Sets to support that authorization of endpoints and the endpoint package's settings.xml file.

endpoint.description: A collection of containers for individual configuration audit reports. There can be up to 100 reports.

nextUri.description:
The URI you can use to obtain the next set of configuration audit reports.

_**Note:** If all available entries are listed on the prior call, the link to the next set might not provide any data._

authorization.description:
The Authorization Sets defined for the Environment.

Authorization Sets can only be defined for Environments of type **EM**.

When querying an Environment, this field is filled in if the **recursive** query parameter is set to **true**. This field is omitted if the **recursive** query parameter is set to **false** or not provided.

deploymentId.description: An [identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) used to relate the request with all Stealth(aware) objects affected by the request.

description.description: The [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the Environment.

enforcement.description:
The minimum level of enforcement or filtering required for network traffic.

| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|---------------|-----------------|------------ |
| ipAddresses | 1 | Filters are generated to enforce IP address policies. |
| ports | 2 | Filters are generated to enforce port policies. |
| ipAddressesAndPorts | 3 | Filters are generated to enforce IP address policies and local port policies. |

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to the Environment.

name.description:
The [name](#section/Validation/Names) of the Environment.

The name must be unique among all Environment names.

type.description:
The type of Environment.

You can only create one Environment of type **EM**.

| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|---------------|-----------------|------------ |
| EM       | EM    | Identifies an Enterprise Manager environment, which consists of servers that are part of the Stealth infrastructure.             |
| USER     | User  | Identifies a user environment, which consists of servers that provide user services. This is equivalent to a Stealth(aware) Project. |
type.x-desc:
The type of Environment.

You can only create one Environment of type **EM**.

Environment.description: An Environment contains a set of Solutions to be configured separately, such as test and production Environments. A configuration is created for each Environment, with each configuration containing the role and COI information for the Environment.

key.description: Identifies the error. Each error has a unique number.

message.description: The error message. The message appears in the language specified by the `Accept-Language` HTTP Header if a translation is available for the indicated language.

localPort.description: Identifies a single [port](#section/Validation/Server-Port) or port range to exclude from the filter's local port range. This value cannot be an asterisk (\*). This value can be omitted, but in that case **remotePort** is required.

remotePort.description: Identifies a single [port](#section/Validation/Server-Port) or port range to exclude from the filter's remote port range. This value cannot be an asterisk (\*). This value can be omitted, but in that case **localPort** is required.

ExceptPort.description:
The except ports apply exceptions to the local and remote ports defined for the qualifier filter. This tag is valid only if **localPort** or **remotePort** contains a port range.

Each **remotePort** identifies a pair of ports that are exceptions to the declared local and remote port ranges. Consider the following example:

```xml
 <localPort>9000-9999</localPort>
 <remotePort>*</remotePort>
 <exceptPorts>
   <exceptPort>
     <localPort>9100</localPort>
     <remotePort>32000-65535</remotePort>
   </exceptPort>
   <exceptPort>
     <localPort>9200</localPort>
   </exceptPort>
   <exceptPort>
     <remotePort>1024-31999</remotePort>
   </exceptPort>
 </exceptPorts>
```

The first two lines mean that local ports 9000 through 9999 will accept connections from any remote port.

The first except port means that for local port 9100, any connections from remote ports 32000 through 65535 will not be accepted. However, that port will accept connections from remote ports that are less than 32000.

The second except port means that local port 9200 will not accept connections from any remote port. This is the same as defining two filters: one with local ports 9000-9199 and the other with local ports 9201-9999.

The third except port means that local ports 9000 through 9999 will not accept any connections from remote ports 1024 through 319999.

description.description: A [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the filter as provided by the user.

filterListId.description:
The unique identifier of the [filter list](#tag/Filter-List) that owns this filter.

If you are creating the resource directly using a [Create Filter](#operation/createFilter) request, you must specify a value for this tag. If you are creating the resource as part of a [Create Filter List](#operation/createFilterList) or an [Update Filter List](#operation/createFilterList) request, this tag is ignored because the unique identifier of the filter list is assumed, meaning that you cannot change which filter list owns this filter.

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to the filter by Enterprise Manager.

ipAddress.description:
The [IP address](#section/Validation/IP-Address) included in the filter.

If you need to modify the IP address of an existing filter, you must make an [Update Filter List](#operation/updateFilterList) request.

qualifier.description:
A collection of qualifiers included in this filter.

This list is maintained in the order in which it is entered.

qualifiersId.description: The unique identifier assigned to the filter by Enterprise Manager.

Filter.description: The [filter](#tag/Filter), which might include embedded qualifiers, included in this filter list.

child.description:
A collection of one or more children of the filter list. A filter list child can be either a [filter](#tag/Filter) (that is, a filter with one or more qualifiers) or a filter list.

When querying a filter list, you will get either **filter** or **filterList**, but not both.

When creating or updating a filter list, you can set either **filter** or **filterList**, but not both. If you set both **filter** and **filterList**, then **filterList** is ignored.

This list is maintained in the order in which it is entered.

createdOn.description: The [date and time](#section/Validation/Date-and-Time) when the filter list was created.

description.description: The [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the filter list as provided by the user.

id.description:
The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to this filter list by Enterprise Manager.

The unique identifier is ignored for the primary resource (that is, the filter list at the root of the filter list tree) during a create or update request. For creating a filter list, refer to the [Create Filter List](#operation/createFilterList) request for a description of how the unique identifier is used for secondary resources (that is, for the child filter lists). For updating a filter list, refer to the [Update Filter List](#operation/updateFilterList) request for a description of how the unique identifier is used for child filter lists.

name.description:
The [name](#section/Validation/Names) of the filter list.

The name must be unique among all of the filter lists in the Enterprise Manager database.

FilterList.description: A collection of [filter lists](#tag/Filter-List) associated with the filter set or parent filter list.

allow.description:
If true, the filter set identifies allowed resources; if false, the filter set identifies denied resources. This value is present only when there is one or more filter lists in this filter set.

This value is required if either of the following occurs:
 * A filter set is created with filter lists
 * A filter set without filter lists is updated to contain filter lists

_**Note:** The allow field is ignored during an update if the filter set does not contain a list of filter lists._

description.description: The [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the resource.

filterList.description:
A collection of [filter lists](#tag/Filter-List) associated with the filter set or parent filter list.



This list is maintained in the order in which it is entered.

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to this resource by Enterprise Manager.

name.description: The [name](#section/Validation/Names) of the resource.

FilterSet.description: A collection of filter lists used to restrict communications

channelId.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) of the parent Channel.

consumerProfileId.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) of the Profile that consumes the service through the Flow. This Profile must be one of the Profiles defined in the parent Channel.

deploymentId.description: An [identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) used to relate the request with all Stealth(aware) objects affected by the request.

description.description: The [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the Flow.

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to the Flow.

name.description:
The [name](#section/Validation/Names) of the Flow.

Unlike other Stealth(aware) objects, a Flow does not require a name. If a name is given, it must be unique among all Flow names.

policy.description:
Identifies the traffic policy for the Flow.

| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|---------------|-----------------|------------ |
| allowStealth | 1 | Allow only Stealth traffic to the endpoint, and block all clear text traffic. |
| allowClearText | 2 | Allow only clear text traffic to the endpoint, and block Stealth traffic. |
| block | 3 | Block all traffic to the endpoint. |

providerProfileId.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) of the Profile providing the service through the Flow. This Profile must be one of the Profiles defined in the parent Channel.

Flow.description: The Flows that belong to the Channel.

description.description: [Description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) supplied by the administrator to inform the reader about the purpose of the group and other helpful information.

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IP-Address) assigned to the group by Enterprise Manager.

name.description:
The [name](#section/Validation/Group-Names) of the group.

This field is ignored when updating the group.

Group.description: A group included in this role. There can be any number of groups in a role (including zero).

deferred.description:
If this value is set to true, the inspection configuration provided in the request is not applied to the endpoint until an [Apply Package Inspection Settings](#operation/deployEndpoint) request is made; if this value set to false, or not set, the configuration is applied immediately.

No value is provided for this field during a read request.

enabled.description: If this value is set to true, the endpoint is monitored; if this value is set to false, the endpoint is not monitored.

pieServer.description: The [IP address](#section/Validation/IP-Address), [host name or fully qualified domain name](#section/Validation/Domain-Names) of the Packet Inspection Enablement Server. The host name or fully qualified domain name must be resolvable using a Domain Name Service (DNS) from the endpoint. All monitored traffic for this endpoint is sent to this server.

InspectionInfo.description: Data that identifies the packet inspection options. This data will not be present if the endpoint is not being monitored.

elapsedTimeMS.description:
The period of time, in milliseconds, between each send of monitored packets to the Packet Inspection Enablement Service.

If you omit the value or provide a value less than 1, it will be automatically reset to the default value (3600000). If the value is between 1 and 1000, it will be reset to the minimum value (1000). If the value is greater than 3600000, it will be reset to the maximum value (3600000).

kiloBytes.description:
The number of kilobytes of monitored data that will be gathered before the monitored packets are sent to the Packet Inspection Enablement Service.

If you omit the value or provide a value less than 1, it will be automatically reset to the default value (60). If the value is greater than 100000, it will be reset to the maximum value (100000).

packetCount.description:
The number of monitored data packets that will be gathered before the monitored packets are sent to the Packet Inspection Enablement Service.

If you omit the value or provide a value less than 1, it will be automatically reset to the default value of 40. If the value is greater than 100000, it will be reset to the maximum value (100000).

InspectionRate.description:
These fields specify how often an endpoint should sent packets to the Packet Inspection Enablement Server.

Note that the first threshold reached for **elapsedTimeMS**, **kiloBytes**, or **packetCount**, causes the monitored packets to be delivered to the Packet Inspection Enablement Server. If the value for all three is set to 1, the monitored packets are delivered immediately.

address.description:
The location of the LDAP server. For example:

`LDAP://ldap.server:3268/DC=mycompany,DC=com`

password.description:
The [password](#section/Validation/Password) for that user account. If a username is provided, a password must be specified.

The password must be encrypted using the public key of the valid, in-use Management Certificate. The encryption must use PKCS#1. The ciphertext must be in little-endian format. The password must be either Hex or Base64-encoded. This field is never returned in the XML/JSON output; it is only used when creating the Authorization Set.

referralChasing.description:
Specifies how referrals are chased when the Authorization Server issues the LDAP query.

| Mnemonic    | Value       | Description                                                                                                                                                       |
|-------------|-------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| ALL         | All         | Chase referrals of either the subordinate or external type.                                                                                                       |
| EXTERNAL    | External    | Chase external referrals.                                                                                                                                         |
| NONE        | None        | Never chase the referred-to server. Setting this option prevents a client from contacting other servers in a referral process.                                    |
| SUBORDINATE | Subordinate | Chase only subordinate referrals that are a subordinate naming context in a directory tree. The ADSI LDAP provider always turns off this flag for paged searches. |
referralChasing.x-desc: Specifies how referrals are chased when the Authorization Server issues the LDAP query.

useSsl.description: Indicates whether the LDAP server uses SSL.

username.description:
The [name of a user account](#section/Validation/User-Names) that will be used to connect to the LDAP server.

This field is required if the authentication scheme is **integratedwindowsauthentication** or **certificate**.

Ldap.description:
Identifies the LDAP settings to use for the Authorization Set.

This data is required if the **authorizationScheme** is **ldap** or **certificate**, is optional for **integratedwindowsauthentication**, and is not used for **registration**.

adminUserName.description:
The sAMAccountName (also known as the pre-Windows 2000 logon name) for the Administrator user account created for Enterprise Manager to communicate with the AD server along with the folder name in the following format:

```CN=UserName,CN=FolderName```

For example, if the Administrator user account on your Active Directory server is named ADAdmin and is in the Users group, enter CN=ADAdmin,CN=Users.

allowNonLdapUser.description: True if non-LDAP users are allowed to connect. False if non-LDAP users are not allowed to connect in addition to LDAP users. This field is ignored unless LDAP is enabled.

baseDn.description: The Base Domain Name for the Active Directory domain that includes your users and groups. For example, if your domain is unisys.com, enter `dc=unisys,dc=com`.

enabled.description:
True if LDAP is enabled, false otherwise. When LDAP is enabled, then the Management Server will:

- Validate Administrative users when they sign in and when they're added to the Administration page against the users defined in the AD server
- Validate Stealth users and groups against the users and groups defined in the AD server

If not enabled, only locally defined Administrator users can be created, and only local Administrator users' credentials are used to log in. For Stealth users or groups, no LDAP information is collected and used for allowing users to connect.

groupDn.description:
The Group Domain Name. You can only specify one domain name. If your users are in organizational units, you must specify those organizational units, either in addition to a domain name or in place of a domain name, separated by semicolons.

For example, if you are using a group domain and it is named Groups, enter `CN=Groups`. However, if you are using organizational units, and your organization units are named Admins and Special Access, you should enter `CN=Groups;OU=Admins;OU=Special Access` or `OU=Admins;OU=Special Access`.

host.description: The [host name](#section/Validation/Domain-Names) or [IP address](#section/Validation/IP-Address) of the Active Directory server.

password.description: The password (in clear text) for the Active Directory server Administrator user account.

port.description: The [port number](#section/Validation/Server-Port) to connect to the Active Directory server. The default is 389.

ssl.description: This indicates if the connection to the LDAP server is secured with SSL or not.

userDn.description:
The User Domain Name. You can only specify one domain name. If users are in organizational units, you must specify those organizational units, either in addition to a domain name or in place of a domain name, separated by semicolons.

For example, if you are using a user domain and it is named Users, enter `CN=Users`. However, if you are using organizational units, and your organization units are named Admins and Special Access, you should enter `CN=Users;OU=Admins;OU=Special Access` or `OU=Admins;OU=Special Access`.

description.description: The [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the license.

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to the license by Enterprise Manager.

licenseKey.description: A license key used to install a license on the system. Required when updating or installing a license. Ignored when installing an SCN.

name.description: A [name](#section/Validation/Names) assigned to the license. If you do not specify a name in a create license request, the name defaults to "Setting for <host-id>".

provider.description: The host name or fully qualified domain name of the license host (either the Management Server or standalone Authorization Server) that runs the License Service and provides licenses.

providerId.description: The unique identifier of the [computer system](#tag/Computer-System) (either the Management Server or standalone Authorization Server) that runs the License Service and provides licenses

scn.description: The System Control Number (SCN) associated with the license.

state.description:
| Mnemonic       | Value | Description                                  |
|----------------|-------|----------------------------------------------|
| notApplicable  | 0     | No information is available for the license. |
| none           | 1     | There is no license.                         |
| installed      | 2     | The license is installed.                    |
| remote         | 3     | The license is remote.                       |
| missing        | 4     | The license is missing.                      |
| lostConnection | 5     | Cannot access the license information.       |

status.description: The status of a specific license.

verificationKey.description: A verification key used to install a license on the system. This value is required when installing or updating a license, and it is ignored when installing an SCN.

webUrl.description: The URL of the Dynamic Licensing Service.

epsId.description: The [Endpoint Property Set (EPS)](#tag/Endpoint-Property-Set) identifier that indicates the authorization behavior for the endpoint.

id.description:
The unique identifier assigned to the node map.

_**Note:** This is not a typical unique identifier in that it can only contain digits._

ipAddress.description:
The [IPv4 addresses](#section/Validation/IP-Address) of the endpoint represented by the node map.

The IPv4 address must be an individual IP address; it cannot be a range or contain a CIDR. The IP addresses must be unique among all the node maps in the Enterprise Manager database.

When creating a node map, you must specify a **name** or at least one **IP address**.

name.description:
The [hostname](#section/Validation/Domain-Names) of the endpoint associated with the node map.

The hostname must be unique among all the node maps in the Enterprise Manager database.

When creating a node map, you must specify a **name** or at least one **IP address**.

packageVersion.description: The reversion number of the endpoint package installed on the endpoint.

NodeMap.description: A node map is used to keep track of Endpoint Property Set node membership and versions. The Authorization Servers use this resource to keep track of when endpoint software needs to be updated or when a node's membership changes.

description.description: The reason for the corresponding operational status value. This might be a text version of the operational status or an alternate description.

status.description:
| Mnemonic              | Value | Description                                                                                                                                                          |
|-----------------------|-------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| unknown               | 0     | The condition of the system is unknown.                                                                                                                              |
| other                 | 1     | The operational status is other (something not defined in this document). See the corresponding description for more information.                                    |
| ok                    | 2     | The system is working normally.                                                                                                                                      |
| degraded              | 3     | The system performance is degraded and might not support the minimum requirements for running the Stealth software. Check other statuses for additional information. |
| stressed              | 4     | The system does not have sufficient resources (memory, CPU, or disk space) to process the workload properly. Check other statuses for additional information.        |
| predictFailure        | 5     | The system detects an imminent failure. Check other statuses for additional information.                                                                             |
| error                 | 6     | The system has detected an internal error. Check other statuses for additional information.                                                                          |
| nonRecoverableError   | 7     | The system has detected an error from which it cannot recover.                                                                                                       |
| starting              | 8     | The system is in the process of starting.                                                                                                                            |
| stopping              | 9     | The system is in the process of stopping.                                                                                                                            |
| stopped               | 10    | The system is stopped.                                                                                                                                               |
| inService             | 11    | The system is being serviced.                                                                                                                                        |
| noContact             | 12    | The system has had no communication from other systems.                                                                                                              |
| lostCommunication     | 13    | The system cannot be reached by other system.                                                                                                                        |
| aborted               | 14    | Stealth software on the system has terminated.                                                                                                                       |
| dormant               | 15    | Stealth software on the system is inactive.                                                                                                                          |
| supportingEntityError | 16    | A service which supports Stealth on this computer has reported an error.                                                                                             |
| completed             | 17    | The system has completed its latest operation.                                                                                                                       |
| power                 | 18    | The system is changing its power state (powering on or off).                                                                                                         |

OperationalStatus.description: A collection of operation statuses of the system. Each instance holds the operational status and its corresponding description.

classification.description:
Identifies how the Profile is used.

This field allows any value; however, the following values are reserved for Profiles for computer systems used in Stealth management:

| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|---------------|-----------------|------------ |
| Bootstrap   | Bootstrap                               | Identifies a Profile used by an endpoint that a Stealth administrator uses to access the Stealth Management Server. |
| EM          | Stealth Management Server               | Identifies a Profile that defines the Enterprise Server.                                                          |
| Global      | Global                                  | Identifies a global Profile used to isolate endpoints and users.                                                  |
| SAAS        | Stealth Standalone Authorization Server | Identifies a Profile that defines a standalone Authorization Server.                                              |
| ServiceMode | Stealth Service Mode                    | Identifies a Profile used by Stealth endpoints in Service Mode.                                                   |
classification.x-desc:
Identifies how the Profile is used.

This field allows any value; however, the following values are reserved for Profiles for computer systems used in Stealth management:

deploymentId.description: An [identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) used to relate the request with all Stealth(aware) objects affected by the request.

description.description: The [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the Profile.

enabled.description:
If true, the Nodes in the Profile are Stealth-enabled. If false, only clear text communication can be used by Nodes in the Profile.

This field is always assumed to be true for a **Global** Profile.

endpointPropertySetId.description:
The unique identifier of the [Endpoint Property Set](#tag/Endpoint-Property-Set) related to the Profile. Refer to [Endpoint Property Set](#tag/Endpoint-Property-Set) for a description of valid Endpoint Property Set identifiers.

This field is ignored if **classification** is not **Global**.

groupName.description:
The [name](#section/Validation/Group-Names) of the Active Directory group associated with the Profile. If no value is provided and the Profile is Stealth-enabled, a user account is generated for use with the Profile.

This field is ignored for a **ServiceMode** or **Global** Profile.

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to the Profile.

ipAddress.description:
A collection of [IPv4 addresses](#section/Validation/IP-Address) for the Nodes in the Profile. A maximum of 1000 IP addresses is allowed.

This field is ignored for a **ServiceMode** or **Global** Profile.

items.description:
A collection of [IPv4 addresses](#section/Validation/IP-Address) for the Nodes in the Profile. A maximum of 1000 IP addresses is allowed.

This field is ignored for a **ServiceMode** or **Global** Profile.

name.description:
The [name](#section/Validation/Names) of the Profile.

The name must be unique among all Profile names.

policy.description:
The default policy on the traffic to or from the endpoints in the Profile. The policy defines COIs, allow filters, and deny filters according to the **enforcement** level selected for the Channels that link the Profile.

| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|---------------|-----------------|------------ |
| allowStealth | 1 | Allow only Stealth traffic to the endpoint, and block all clear text traffic. |
| allowClearText | 2 | Allow only clear text traffic to the endpoint, and block Stealth traffic. |
| block | 3 | Block all traffic to the endpoint. |

updateQueueLimit.description:
The maximum number of concurrent endpoint package downloads allowed from the Authorization Service to the endpoints.

This field is ignored if **classification** is not **Stealth Standalone Authorization Server**.

The value must be positive; a negative value changes to 0.

Profile.description:
The Profiles that are part of the Solution. A maximum of 100 Profiles is allowed.

To reference an existing Profile during a load request, provide only the Profile's **id** field. If you provide a complete Profile (at least the **id** and **name** fields), and if the **id** references an existing Profile, it updates with the data provided. If there is no Profile with that **id**, then one is created. You can mix and match complete Profiles and references to existing Profiles.

You must provide all Profiles for the Solution during a load request. If the Solution already exists, any Profiles that are part of the existing Solution that are not provided during the load request are deleted.

direction.description:
Identifies the inbound and outbound Stealth tunnel establishment.

You cannot set both Profiles to **Accept** or **Initiate**.

| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|---------------|-----------------|------------ |
| Default  | 0     | Enables the Stealth workgroup COI to both initiate outbound tunnels and accept inbound tunnels.                                                            |
| Initiate | 16201 | Restricts the Stealth workgroup COI to initiate outbound Stealth tunnels. Once a tunnel is established, communication can flow in either direction.      |
| Accept   | 16202 | Restricts the Stealth workgroup COI to accept inbound Stealth tunnel requests. Once a tunnel is established, communication can flow in either direction. |
direction.x-desc:
Identifies the inbound and outbound Stealth tunnel establishment.

You cannot set both Profiles to **Accept** or **Initiate**.

enforcement.description:
Defines the filters to be used for the traffic in the Channel.

| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|---------------|-----------------|------------ |
| unknown | 0 | The enforcement behavior is inherited from the owning Environment. |
| ipAddresses | 1 | Filters are generated to enforce IP address policies. |
| ports | 2 | Filters are generated to enforce port policies. |
| ipAddressesAndPorts | 3 | Filters are generated to enforce IP address policies and local port policies. |
| providerPortsAndConsumerAddresses | 5 | Filters are generated to enforce local port policies on the providing services and IP address policies on the consuming Profiles. |

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) of the Profile.

order.description:
Defines the relative priority of the Channel.

Negative values are treated as zero. Smaller values are ordered higher than larger values, and zero indicates unordered. The values for the Channels in a Solution need not be consecutive, and duplicate values imply the same priority. For example, order values of 1, 0, 10, 8, 17, 10, 0, 6 result in an ordering of 1, 6, 8, 10, 10, 17, 0, 0.

ProfileInformation.description:
Information about the Profile at one end of the Channel.

Internal Channels, where a Profile is linked to itself, only have information about the primary Profile. External Channels, where two Profiles are linked to each other, have information about the primary and secondary Profiles.

channel.description: A collection of Channels. This is mainly intended for Channels that link Profiles in different Solutions but can be used for all Channels.

endpointPropertySet.description: A collection of Endpoint Property Sets.

flow.description: A collection of Flows. This is mainly intended for Flows that do not belong to any of the Channels in the Project.

profile.description: A collection of Profiles. This is mainly intended for Profiles that do not belong to any of the Solutions in the Project but can be used for all Profiles.

description.description: The [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the qualifier.

filter.description:
A list of one or more qualifier filters.

This list is maintained in the order in which it is entered.

id.description:
The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to the qualifier by Enterprise Manager.

The unique identifier is ignored for the primary resource during a create request; that is, when the create request is for a qualifier. Refer to the [Create Filter](#operation/createFilter) request for a description of how the unique identifier is used for secondary resources (that is, for qualifiers contained within a filter list during a filter list or filter set create request).

isProtocolQualifier.description:
If true, all filters are protocol/port filters. If false or not present, all filters are IP address filters.

This field is ignored during an update request. The value of this field cannot be changed during an update.

name.description: The [name](#section/Validation/Names) of the qualifier.

Qualifier.description: A filter list defines a group of IP addresses. This group of addresses may be used to allow or restrict traffic. A filter list may contain other filter lists as subcomponents. The filter list may be further defined by filter qualifiers. A qualifier may restrict the filter to a set of ports, and it may control messages that are allowed from a port on a remote system, or to a local port. A qualifier may also further subdivide the list of addresses.

exceptPort.description:
The except ports apply exceptions to the local and remote ports defined for the qualifier filter. This tag is valid only if **localPort** or **remotePort** contains a port range.

Each **remotePort** identifies a pair of ports that are exceptions to the declared local and remote port ranges. Consider the following example:

```xml
 <localPort>9000-9999</localPort>
 <remotePort>*</remotePort>
 <exceptPorts>
   <exceptPort>
     <localPort>9100</localPort>
     <remotePort>32000-65535</remotePort>
   </exceptPort>
   <exceptPort>
     <localPort>9200</localPort>
   </exceptPort>
   <exceptPort>
     <remotePort>1024-31999</remotePort>
   </exceptPort>
 </exceptPorts>
```

The first two lines mean that local ports 9000 through 9999 will accept connections from any remote port.

The first except port means that for local port 9100, any connections from remote ports 32000 through 65535 will not be accepted. However, that port will accept connections from remote ports that are less than 32000.

The second except port means that local port 9200 will not accept connections from any remote port. This is the same as defining two filters: one with local ports 9000-9199 and the other with local ports 9201-9999.

The third except port means that local ports 9000 through 9999 will not accept any connections from remote ports 1024 through 319999.

exclude.description: Indicates whether the protocols in **protocol** are excluded (true) or included (false) by the parent qualifier.

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to the qualifier filter by Enterprise Manager.

ipAddress.description:
The [IP address](#section/Validation/IP-Address) that is allowed by the parent qualifier.

 During a create or update request, if an IP address is specified, all other protocol fields are ignored.

localPort.description: The local [port](#section/Validation/Server-Port) used to filter inbound traffic. During a create request, this tag is required only if **exclude** is false and **protocol** value is TCP or UDP.

protocol.description:
The [protocol](#section/Validation/Network-Protocol) defined for the parent qualifier.

 If **exclude** is true, you can specify only a single protocol.

 If **exclude** is false, you can specify a single protocol value, a range of protocols (separated by a hyphen), or a comma-separated list of protocol values or ranges.

qualifierId.description:
The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) of the [qualifier](#tag/Qualifier) that owns this qualifier filter.

If you are creating the resource directly using a [Create Qualifier Filter](#operation/createQualifierFilter) request, you must specify a value for this tag. If you are creating the resource as part of a [Create Qualifier](#operation/createQualifier) request, this tag is ignored because the unique identifier of the created qualifier is assumed. This field is also ignored during an update request, meaning that you cannot change which qualifier owns this qualifier filter.

remotePort.description: The remote [port](#section/Validation/Server-Port) used to filter outbound traffic. During a create request, this tag is required only if **exclude** is false and **protocol** value is TCP or UDP.

QualifierFilter.description: Filter qualifiers are used to identify either protocol/port combinations that are allowed (or not allowed), or IP address ranges that are allowed.

createdResource.description:
If the request was to create a resource, then this is a list of information about the created resources. This field is used during create requests and in some update requests that require new resources to be created. This field is unused for all other requests.

Information about one of the created resources. The first entry in the list usually pertains to the primary resource. However, if a resource is created during an update, that resource might not be the primary resource.

deploymentId.description: An [identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) used to relate the request with all Stealth(aware) objects affected by the request.

description.description: A [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the asynchronous request.

finishedAt.description:
The [time](#section/Validation/Date-and-Time) when the asynchronous request either completed successfully or stopped due to an error. This field is not set while there are tasks still to perform.

The script can use this field as a flag to identify when the request has stopped processing, as setting this field is the last thing done while processing a background task.

id.description: A UUID that uniquely identifies this request status.

message.description:
A collection of progress messages for the tasks that make up the request.

A progress message that describes the progress of a task.

progress.description: The percentage complete of the request, from 0 to 100 percent. If the request encounters an error, the final progress is typically less than 100.

scheduledAt.description: The [time](#section/Validation/Date-and-Time) when the asynchronous request is scheduled for execution.

startedAt.description: The [time](#section/Validation/Date-and-Time) when the asynchronous request was made.

state.description:
| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|------------|------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| error      | error      | The request was halted due to an error that prevent any further tasks from being attempted, or the request failed for the primary resource.              |
| finished   | finished   | The request ran to completion with all tasks completing successfully.                                                                                    |
| incomplete | incomplete | The request ran to completion, however, one of more tasks were not successful and raised warnings. This final state occurs if the tasks are independent. |
| running    | running    | The request is still being processed.                                                                                                                    |
| waiting    | waiting    | The request has been placed into the queue and has not yet been started.                                                                                 |
| scheduled  | scheduled  | The request is scheduled to run at some time in the future. The request is not placed into the run queue until the scheduled time. |

taskCount.description: The expected number of tasks that will be performed to complete the request.

uri.description: The full URI that can be used to get this request status.

warningDetected.description: This is set to true if a task terminates with a warning message.

RequestStatus.description: The request status is used to provide status information about an asynchronous request.

key.description: The key used to build the message.

timestamp.description: The [time](#section/Validation/Date-and-Time) when this message was generated.

type.description:
| Mnemonic   | Value      | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |
|------------|------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| checkpoint | checkpoint | Indicates that this message is a checkpoint or informational message generated during the processing of a task.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| end        | end        | Indicates that this message is for the successful completion of a task.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| error      | error      | Indicates that this message is for an issue that was encountered during the processing of a task that prevents the task from completing. The text of the message identifies the error. The request stops at this point, no further tasks are run.                                                                                                                                              |
| start      | start      | Indicates that this message is for the start of a task.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| warning    | warning    | Indicates that this message is for a problem that was encountered during the processing of a task that prevents the task from completing. The text of the message identifies the problem encountered by this task. While the task might not have completed successfully, the rest of the tasks for the request are still attempted. There might be several warning messages for a single task. |

RequestStatusMessage.description:
A collection of progress messages for the tasks that make up the request.

A progress message that describes the progress of a task.

name.description: The name of the resource.

requestCount.description: The number of requests made to the resource since the last time the EcoAPI was started.

Resource.description: A list of EcoAPI resources that have been accessed since the last time the EcoAPI was started, along with the total number of requests made to each of them.

authorizationService.description:
A list of all Authorization Services that identify the Authorization Groups used by the global isolation role.

This list applies only to global isolation roles.

For create and update requests, only the unique identifier is used; all other fields are ignored.

This list is maintained in the order in which it is entered.

coi.description:
The collection of [COIs](#tag/COI) assigned to the role.

This list is maintained in the order in which it is entered.

configurationId.description:
The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) of the configuration that owns this role.

If you are creating the resource directly using a [Create Role](#operation/createRole) request, you must specify a value for this tag. If you are creating the resource as part of a [Create Configuration](#operation/createConfiguration) request, this tag is ignored because  the unique identifier of the created configuration is assumed. This field is also ignored during an update request; that is, you cannot change which configuration a role belongs to.

description.description: A [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the role as provided by the user.

endpoint.description:
A collection of isolated endpoints. This information is available only for a global isolation role.

To isolate endpoints (and add them to a global isolation role), use the [Isolate Users or Endpoints](#operation/isolateRole) request. To remove endpoints from isolation, use the [Unisolate Users or Endpoints](#operation/unisolateRole) request.

An endpoint that has been isolated in this global isolation role. There can be any number of endpoints in a global isolation role (including zero).

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to the role by Enterprise Manager.

name.description:
The [name](#section/Validation/Names) of the role.

This field is not required when updating a role.

Once a global isolation role is provisioned, the name is ignored during an update request; the name cannot be changed after provisioning.

provisioned.description:
Indicates if the role has been provisioned.

This field applies only to global isolation roles.

type.description:
Identifies how this role is used.

If this value is not specified during a create request, and if the parent configuration is a global configuration, then the value **global** is assumed. Otherwise, the value **workgroup** is assumed.

This field is ignored during an update request; you cannot change the role's type after it has been created.

| Mnemonic  | Value     | Description                                                                                     |
|-----------|-----------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| GLOBAL    | Global    | Identifies a global role used to isolate endpoints and users.                                   |
| SERVICE   | Service   | Identifies a service role used by endpoints in service mode to access an Authorization Service. |
| WORKGROUP | WorkGroup | Identifies a work group role used by endpoints during normal operation.                         |
type.x-desc:
Identifies how this role is used.

If this value is not specified during a create request, and if the parent configuration is a global configuration, then the value **global** is assumed. Otherwise, the value **workgroup** is assumed.

This field is ignored during an update request; you cannot change the role's type after it has been created.

authenticationScheme.description:
For an __Auth Web__ service, identifies the authentication scheme supported by the Authorization Group related to this instance.

| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|---------------|-----------------|------------ |
| CERTIFICATE  | certificate                     | Authentication is based on certificates.                       |
| IWA          | integratedwindowsauthentication | Authentication is based on the local Windows accounts.         |
| LDAP         | ldap                            | Authentication is based on the accounts defined in an LDAP server. |
| REGISTRATION | registration                    | This authentication information is used to register endpoints. |
authenticationScheme.x-desc: For an __Auth Web__ service, identifies the authentication scheme supported by the Authorization Group related to this instance.

authorizationGroup.description: For an __Auth Web__ service, identifies the name of the Authorization Group related to this instance.

computerSystemId.description: The unique identifier of the [computer system](#tag/Computer-System) running the service. The value is either the [host name](#section/Validation/Domain-Names) or [IP Address](#section/Validation/IP-Address) of the system.

description.description: The [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the service.

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to the service by Enterprise Manager.

installDate.description: The [date](#section/Validation/Date-and-Time) when the service was installed on the computer system.

name.description: The [name](#section/Validation/Names) of the service.

stealthReleaseLevel.description: The version of Stealth that is installed on the computer system running the service.

uri.description:
The full URI used to access the service.

When creating a **License Admin** service, this value must be specified in the form of [host](#section/Validation/Domain-Names):[port](#section/Validation/Server-Port). The host must be a hostname or the fully-qualified domain name of a host.

A value of "None" for a **License Admin** service indicates this license provider does not have an SCN installed.

usage.description:
Text that identifies the service usage.



| Mnemonic       | Value          | Description                                          |
|----------------|----------------|------------------------------------------------------|
| AUTH_ADMIN     | Auth Admin     | The authorization service for an administration URL. |
| AUTH_WEB       | Auth Web       | The authorization service for an AuthGroup.          |
| LICENSE_ADMIN  | License Admin  | The license provider service.                        |
| LICENSE_WEB    | License Web    | The dynamic license service.                         |
| MANAGEMENT_WEB | Management Web | The Management service.                              |
| MONITOR_WEB    | Monitor Web    | The monitoring service.                              |
| VPN_ADMIN      | VPN Admin      | The VPN Admin service.                               |
usage.x-desc: Text that identifies the service usage.

Service.description: A service is an Authorization Service or License Service that attaches to a configuration so that endpoints can be authorized or licensed.

packageVersion.description: The version of the endpoint package distributed to the endpoints. This version also appears as part of the endpoint package filename.

ServiceProfile.description:
These values are used to create a service Profile.

These values are ignored if **classification** is not **Stealth Service Mode**.

authGroupName.description: The [name](#section/Validation/Group-Names) of the AuthGroup used to authorize the user logged in to the endpoint.
