authServerId.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) of the system on which the Authorization Service (either the Management Server or a standalone Authorization Server) that authorized the current endpoint session is running. You can use this identifier to get information about the system using [Get Computer System](#operation/getComputerSystemById)

coiName.description:
A collection of one or more COI [names](#section/Validation/Names).

The name of a COI that the endpoint is using for communication.

items.description:
A collection of one or more COI [names](#section/Validation/Names).

The name of a COI that the endpoint is using for communication.

createdAt.description: The  [date and time](#section/Validation/Date-and-Time) that the session information was generated by the Authorization Service.

diagnosticRecordNumber.description: The number assigned to the diagnostic service record for the endpoint session.

domainUser.description: The name of the user account that is logged into the endpoint. For a server endpoint, this is the user account that the Unisys Stealth Logon service is configured to run under.

endPointId.description: The IP address or host name of the endpoint communicating with the Authorization Service.

endPointSoftwareLevel.description: The version of the Stealth software installed on the endpoint.

expiresAt.description: The [date and time](#section/Validation/Date-and-Time) that the session information expires.

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to this session by Enterprise Manager. The identifier is valid only for the current session with the endpoint; if the session is reset, it is issued a new unique identifier.

ipAddress.description: The [IP address](#section/Validation/IP-Address) of the endpoint. This is a single IP address.

keepAliveTimer.description: The number of milliseconds since the last keep-alive message was received by the Authorization Service.

licenseType.description:
The type of license provided by the Authorization Service based on the type of endpoint.

| Mnemonic       | Value          | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|----------------|----------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| awsMarketplace | AWSMarketplace | For Stealth(cloud) for AWS, licenses for endpoints that are deployed in AWS.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| client         | Client         | Licenses for endpoints that use client operating systems.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| mobile         | Mobile         | Licenses for remote users using Secure Remote Access (SRA) clients.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| server         | Server         | Licenses for endpoints that use server operating systems.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| sraGateway     | SRA Gateway    | For environments that include the SRA Gateway, the license for the SRA Gateway. This license is an administrative license and is used to establish a session from the SRA Gateway to the Authorization Service. This license type is built into the solution; it is not orderable, and no configuration is required.                                  |
| svGateway      | SV Gateway     | For environments that include the Secure Virtual Gateway, the license for the Secure Virtual Gateway. This license is an administrative license and is used to establish a session from the Secure Virtual Gateway to the Authorization Service. This license type is built into the solution; it is not orderable, and no configuration is required. |
| vgd            | VGD            | Virtual Gateway Device licenses for Clear Text endpoints that use the Secure Virtual Gateway.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |
licenseType.x-desc: The type of license provided by the Authorization Service based on the type of endpoint.

osArchitecture.description: Identifies whether the operating system uses 32-bit, 64-bit, or some other architecture on the endpoint.

osVersion.description: The operating system version running on the endpoint.

packageId.description: The identifier of the endpoint software package that established the session.

packageVersion.description: The revision level of the endpoint software package that established the session.

roleName.description:
A collection of one or more roles associated with the session.

The configuration and role associated with the session. The format is *{configuration-name}*:*{role-name}*.

items.description:
A collection of one or more roles associated with the session.

The configuration and role associated with the session. The format is *{configuration-name}*:*{role-name}*.

dl.description: See [Get Settings](#operation/getSettings) for a description of the response.

authorization.description:
The Authorization Sets used to provision the Solution.

For a load request, only the Authorization Set **id** field is required; all other Authorization fields are ignored.

This field is required for a Solution of **type** **User** but ignored otherwise. You can specify up to 100 Authorization Sets.

channel.description:
The Channels that are part of the Solution.

During a load request, you must provide only the new Channels being defined. If the load request updates an existing Solution, all Channels that were previously defined for the Profiles that are still in the Solution are retained. Thus, only new Channels for existing Profiles and Channels used by new Profiles need to be defined.

deploymentId.description: An [identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) used to relate the request with all Stealth(aware) objects affected by the request.

description.description: The [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the Solution.

environmentId.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) of the Environment that owns the Solution.

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to the Solution.

name.description:
The [name](#section/Validation/Names) of the Solution.

The name must be unique among all Solution names.

profile.description:
The Profiles that are part of the Solution. A maximum of 100 Profiles is allowed.

To reference an existing Profile during a load request, provide only the Profile's **id** field. If you provide a complete Profile (at least the **id** and **name** fields), and if the **id** references an existing Profile, it updates with the data provided. If there is no Profile with that **id**, then one is created. You can mix and match complete Profiles and references to existing Profiles.

You must provide all Profiles for the Solution during a load request. If the Solution already exists, any Profiles that are part of the existing Solution that are not provided during the load request are deleted.

type.description:
The type of Solution.

| Mnemonic | Value | Description |
|---------------|-----------------|------------ |
| GLOBAL   | Global | Identifies a global Solution used to isolate endpoints and users. There can be at most one global Solution. The Solution can only contain Profiles with classification of "Global". |
| SM       | SM     | Identifies a Stealth Management Solution used to identify the Stealth services and computer systems running them. The Solution can only contain Profiles with classification of "EM", "SAAS", "ServiceMode" or "AdminWrkst". |
| USER     | User   | Identifies a user Solution. This Solution type cannot have any of the Profile classifications specified for the Stealth Management Solution.                                                                                         |

available.description: The number of licenses that are currently available (not in use) to the local Authorization Service.

inUse.description: The number of licenses that has been requested by the local Authorization Service.

max.description: The maximum number of licenses that are available (that is, both in use and available) to the local Authorization Service.

status.description:
| Mnemonic | Value | Description                                  |
|----------|-------|----------------------------------------------|
| unknown  | 0     | No information is available for the license. |
| ok       | 1     | License is functional                        |
| degraded | 2     | License is degraded.                         |
| error    | 3     | There is a problem with the license.         |

totalAvailable.description: If the license file is installed on this server, the number of licenses currently available (not in use) for all Authorization Services. If the license file is installed on a different server, this value is not applicable and is displayed as -.

totalInUse.description: If the license file is installed on this server, the number of licenses that has been requested by all Authorization Services. If the license file is installed on a different server, this value is not applicable and is displayed as -.

totalMax.description: If the license file is installed on this server, the maximum number of licenses that is available (that is, both in use and available) for all Authorization Services. If the license file is installed on a different server, this value is not applicable and is displayed as -.

type.description:
| Mnemonic       | Value          | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
|----------------|----------------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| awsMarketplace | AWSMarketplace | For Stealth(cloud) for AWS, licenses for endpoints that are deployed in AWS.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| client         | Client         | Licenses for endpoints that use client operating systems.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| mobile         | Mobile         | Licenses for remote users using Secure Remote Access (SRA) clients.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| server         | Server         | Licenses for endpoints that use server operating systems.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| sraGateway     | SRA Gateway    | For environments that include the SRA Gateway, the license for the SRA Gateway. This license is an administrative license and is used to establish a session from the SRA Gateway to the Authorization Service. This license type is built into the solution; it is not orderable, and no configuration is required.                                  |
| svGateway      | SV Gateway     | For environments that include the Secure Virtual Gateway, the license for the Secure Virtual Gateway. This license is an administrative license and is used to establish a session from the Secure Virtual Gateway to the Authorization Service. This license type is built into the solution; it is not orderable, and no configuration is required. |
| vgd            | VGD            | Virtual Gateway Device licenses for Clear Text endpoints that use the Secure Virtual Gateway.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |

Status.description: The status of a specific license.

value.description: The string value that was returned in response to the request. Refer to the request for details regarding the value.

description.description: A [description](#section/Validation/Descriptions) of the user.

displayName.description:
The display [name](#section/Validation/Names) for a user. This is usually the combination of the user's first name, middle initial, and last name. This value must be unique.

This field will default to the **name** value if not specified. This field is ignored when updating a user.

id.description: The [unique identifier](#section/Validation/IDs) assigned to the user by Enterprise Manager.

isLocal.description: Indicates whether the user is registered in the Enterprise Manager database as a local user (true) or an LDAP or Active Directory user (false).

name.description:
The [user ID](#section/Validation/User-Names) used to sign in to a Stealth endpoint. For example, **jane.doe@example.org** or **doejane**. When making requests to isolate a user in a domain, this value can contain backslashes; for example, domain\doejane. This value must be unique.

This field is ignored when updating a user.

organizationalUnit.description:
Indicates the organizational unit (OU) of the user registered as an LDAP or Active Directory user.

This field will only contain information if LDAP is enabled when the user is created in the Enterprise Manager, and it provides the user's organizational unit at the time the user is created. Any modifications made in Active Directory after the user is created are not reflected in this field.

password.description:
The encrypted and encoded [password](#section/Validation/Password) to secure the certificate-based authorization certificate for the user.

A password must be set for a user if you want to authorize the user using certificate-based authorization and you want Enterprise Manager to create a certficate for this purpose. The password is used when creating the file for the certificate-based authorization certificate associated with the user.

The password must be encrypted using the public key of the valid, in-use Management Certificate. The encryption must use PKCS#1. The ciphertext must be in little-endian format. The password must be either Hex or Base64-encoded. This field is never returned in the XML/JSON output; it is only used when creating a user.

 You can only provide a password in an update user request if the user was created with a password.

previousPassword.description:
The previous [password](#section/Validation/Password) used to secure the certificate-based authorization certificate for the user, which is required in an update password request.

The password must be encrypted using the public key of the valid, in-use Management Certificate. The encryption must use PKCS#1. The ciphertext must be in little-endian format. The password must be either Hex or Base64-encoded. This field will never appear in the XML/JSON output.

User.description: A user included in this role. There can be any number of users in a role (including zero).
